main event: A single bright silver round object was observed in Luther, Michigan on 3 February 1956.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 20-30 minutes., The object was 4 feet across and flew in a straight and level course., The weather conditions were clear and calm., The observer was monitoring for aircraft thus providing a credible report., Conclusions from this sighting include possibilities of it being a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object.
witness description: a grand observer watching for aircraft, Mr. 47, Luther Mich
